articles.title: Reply to Kim Jong Il from Hu Jintao
articles.content:
Reply to Kim Jong Il from Hu Jintao
Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Kim Jong Il, general secretary of the Workers' Party of Korea and chairman of the National Defence Commission of the DPRK, on July 6 received a message from Hu Jintao, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China and president of the People's Republic of China, in reply to his message of greeting sent to the latter on the occasion of the 90th anniversary of the founding of the CPC.
					 The reply message said:
					
					 I express sincere thanks to you for sending a congratulatory message to me on the occasion of the 90th anniversary of the founding of the CPC.
					
					 We wish to promote the steady development of the Sino-DPRK friendly and cooperative relations, provide the two countries and two peoples with happiness and defend and push forward regional peace, stability and prosperity through the concerted efforts with the DPRK side.
					
					 We wholeheartedly hope that the Workers' Party of Korea headed by General Secretary Kim Jong Il will steadily register new greater successes in accomplishing the cause of building a thriving socialist nation by leading the Korean people.

articles.title: Choe Yong Rim Visits Tudan Duck Farm
articles.content:
Choe Yong Rim Visits Tudan Duck Farm
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Premier Choe Yong Rim Thursday acquainted himself with the Tudan Duck Farm on the spot.
					 Visiting several places of the farm including the hatching room and breeding room, he convened a consultative meeting.
					
					 Discussed at the meeting were issues of finishing the renovation of the farm, which has an important part to play in improving the dietary life of the citizens, as soon as possible and keeping the production going at a high rate.
					
					 Earlier the premier went round the second commodity exhibition of Pyongyang Department Store No. 1. He stressed the need to carry through the party policy to provide enough raw and other materials needed for the factories of light industry in order to supply more quality commodities to the people.

articles.title: Choe Thae Bok Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday had a talk with Le Quang Ba, a newly-appointed Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, when the latter paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Chinese Party Hopes for Wide Exchanges and Visits with Korean Party
articles.content:
Chinese Party Hopes for Wide Exchanges and Visits with Korean Party
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Zhou Yongkang, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Communist Party of China who is also secretary of Central Committee of Politics and Law, had a talk with the friendship visiting group of the Workers' Party of Korea headed by Thae Jong Su, alternate member of the Political Bureau and secretary of the Central Committee of the WPK, at the Great Hall of the People in Beijing Wednesday.
					 Zhou Yongkang recollected with deep emotion his meeting with General Secretary Kim Jong Il in the DPRK last October.
					
					 He said Kim Jong Il visited China several times and contributed to putting the traditional relations of friendship between the two countries to a new level.
					
					 Referring to the recent frequent high-ranking visits between the two parties in accordance with the agreement between the top leaders of the two parties he hoped there would be wide-ranging visits and exchanges in the future, too.
					
					 He sincerely wished the Korean people bigger successes in their efforts to build a thriving nation by 2012 marking the 100th birth anniversary of President Kim Il Sung.

articles.title: Chinese Art Group Here
articles.content:
Chinese Art Group Here
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- An art group of dance drama "Confetti on Silk Road" of the Gansu Provincial Song and Dance Theatre of China headed by Zhang Ming, vice-director of the Cultural Department of Gansu Province, arrived in Pyongyang Thursday to visit the DPRK. It came here to mark the 50th anniversary of the conclusion of the DPRK-China treaty of friendship, cooperation and mutual assistance and the 30th anniversary of the performance of the dance drama in the DPRK.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Anti-Reunification Remarks Blasted
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Anti-Reunification Remarks Blasted 
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The National Reunification Institute Wednesday issued a white paper indicting traitor Lee Myung Bak of south Korea for his remarks escalating confrontation against reunification.
					 The white paper says:
					
					 In his declaration for presidential campaign Lee described the signal improvement of the north-south relations after the publication of the June 15 joint declaration as "south-north relations led by the north" and "a lost decade."
					
					 When interviewed by media on February 1, 2008, he totally negated the joint declaration, saying "it doesn't mean that the successor has to carry out what his predecessors signed in Pyongyang. I will make clear what to do first, what to do next and what should not be done." 
					
					 In his presidential inaugural speech he said he would shape north policy based on pragmatism, not on idea. At "March 1 commemoration speech", the first one after his inauguration, and at a ceremony of appointing army generals on April 3 he decried the idea of "By our nation itself" as "narrow-minded nationalism" and "national chauvinism", saying "it will never help solve the south-north relations."
					
					 To block north-south dialogue and relations he put up all kinds of pretexts including "dismantlement of nuclear weapons", "sincerity", "maintenance of principle" and "change of north's attitude."
					
					  At a meeting held to hear a working report of the Unification Ministry on March 26, 2008, etc. he dropped a checkbar on the north-south cooperation, talking about "dismantlement of nuclear program first" and "drain on resources". On November 12 of the same year he said "he is waiting for the north to change its attitude. Waiting is also a strategy."
					
					 He made no scruple of asserting he would not "hold talks without principle", "the present south-north relations are going on its normal orbit" and he "does not care whether he will have no chance to have a summit during his tenure of office."
					
					 On Nov. 30, 2007 he said "the north should know that it cannot expect anything unless it dismantles its nuclear program and opts for reform and opening." Early in February 2008 when interviewed by media, he noted "the north's dismantlement of nuclear weapons is a precondition for the improvement of the south-north relations". In his presidential inaugural speech he went the lengths of officially declaring "no nukes, opening and 3 000 dollars" as the "north policy."
					
					 Speaking at the opening session of the 18th "National Assembly" and at an interview with foreign reporters on September 26, he also pinpointed "the north's dismantlement of nuclear weapons" as a "top priority in north policy," "primary task" and "master key". He disclosed his intention not to advance the north-south relations even a bit unless it is solved.
					
					 He talked about someone's "change" and "opening" and "unification under liberal democracy" in wanton violation of the three principles of national reunification, basic principles of the north-south relations, thereby escalating the confrontation of systems. This pushed the north-south relations to such phase that they are no longer repairable.
					
					 He even set the duty and function of the puppet Ministry of Unification not for the improvement of north-south relations, reconciliation and cooperation but for "unification through absorption" and called on the ministry to get prepared for it. He brought together even riff-raffs and human scum and instigated them to intensify the scattering of leaflets and anti-DPRK broadcasting.
					
					 On Sept 26, 2008 the traitor visited the puppet army's joint demonstration firing exercise ground where the warmongers fired at the DPRK flag. There he complemented them, blustering "there is no rear separated from front in a modern warfare. The army should get fully ready to go into action." At major commanding officers' meeting on May 4, 2010 he cried out for "establishing principal enemy concept" while talking about "hostile relations with the north" and "specific situation".
					
					 At talks with the people over "Cheonan" case and talk-fest with those of the Consultative Council for Democracy and Peaceful Unification he blustered that "one should know there is the most warlike group just 50 km ahead", "one should take a firm stand", "one should not be afraid of a war" and "now is the time to show action rather than words."
					
					 When he inspected the commanding control post of the puppet Joint Chiefs of Staff on Nov. 23 and a forefront unit of the puppet army on Dec. 23, 2010, he said "countermeasures should be taken even in violation of wartime rules," "a big counterattack should be mounted", "we will make them pay due price" and "one should open one's eyes wide to watch the north."
					
					 On June 24, 2011 he called members of the Defense Committee of the puppet National Assembly to Chongwadae where he said he "regrets so deeply for failing to strike the north during Yonphyong Island shelling." He added: I felt surge of anger. Still I can't calm down myself. I can't tolerate.
					
					 These are just part of his remarks carried by south Korean media, the white paper said, adding his biggest treason can never be pardoned.

articles.title: Documentary Film Shown
articles.content:
Documentary Film Shown
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Documentary "Finding Himself among the People All His Life" (7) was screened at the People's Palace of Culture on Thursday on the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The film deals with the exploits of the President who wisely led the Korean people in their struggle to build socialism under the banner of the three revolutions, ideological, technological and cultural since the historic Fifth Congress of the Workers' Party of Korea. 
					
					 It vividly shows the scenes of the President, who put forward the tasks of the three-major technical revolutions, initiated the three-revolution team movement, provided field guidance to every nook and corner of the country and showed loving care for the people with dedication.
					
					 It impressively deals with the fact that he introduced the universal 11-year compulsory education in the DPRK and completely abolished the tax system to make the centuries-old desire of the Korean people come true.
					
					 The film also tells about the world of noble comradeship of the President who made sure that the revolutionary martyrs cemetery was built, never forgetting the anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters. 
					
					 Appreciating the film were senior party, state and army officials, chairperson of a friendly party and officials of armed forces organs, power bodies, working people's organizations, ministries, national institutions, educational, scientific, cultural and arts, public health and media fields.

articles.title: Floral Basket Laid before Statue of Kim Il Sung
articles.content:
Floral Basket Laid before Statue of Kim Il Sung
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Chief Jo Il Min and members of the Pyongyang mission of the Anti-Imperialist National Democratic Front laid a floral basket before the statue of President Kim Il Sung at Kim Il Sung University on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of demise of the President on Thursday.
					 They laid a floral basket before the statue in boundless reverence for the President and made bows.
					
					 On the same day, they laid bunches of flowers before the bust of Kim Jong Suk, anti-Japanese war hero, at the Revolutionary Martyrs Cemetery on Mt. Taesong.

articles.title: More Rallies Condemn Lee Myung Bak Group of S. Korea
articles.content:
More Rallies Condemn Lee Myung Bak Group of S. Korea
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Army-people rallies took place in North Phyongan, North Hwanghae and South Hamgyong provinces on Thursday to condemn the Lee Myung Bak group of worst traitors for their crimes.
					 The statement of a spokesman for the Korean People's Army Supreme Command was read out to be followed by speeches. 
					
					 The speakers branded the treacherous group as the sworn enemy whom the Koreans can never live under the same sky and the group of traitors to be wiped out by arms.
					
					 They went on:
					
					 The treacherous groups dared to perpetrate such provocation as declaring that it would not rule out even a war against the DPRK. So, the army and people of the DPRK would wipe out the provocateurs to the last man in the sky and on the land with the might of Songun.
					
					 Bearing in mind the immutable truth that we will always emerge victorious as led by Kim Jong Il, we would firmly defend Korean-style socialism, our life and soul, they noted.
					
					 Present there were leading officials of local party and power bodies and working people's organizations, servicepersons, working people and youth and students.

articles.title: Book Comes Off Press
articles.content:
Book Comes Off Press 
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The Workers' Party of Korea Publishing House published the book "Collection of Data about the Revolutionary History of the Great Leader Comrade Kim Il Sung" Vol. 13 compiled by the Party History Institute of the Central Committee of the WPK.
					 The book deals with the revolutionary activities conducted by President Kim Il Sung from Oct. Juche 28 (1939) to Aug. Juche 29 (1940).
					
					 Chapter 1 of the book records the teachings given by him while recollecting the period of the large-unit circling operation of the main forces of the Korean People's Revolutionary Army and when he organized and led the separate activities to finally foil the Japanese imperialists' "special clean-up campaign for maintaining public peace in the southeastern areas."
					
					 Chapter 2 of the book contains the reminiscences of the anti-Japanese revolutionary fighters who experienced the greatness of Kim Il Sung.
					
					 Chapter 3 deals with Korean and foreign publications which introduced battles commanded by Kim Il Sung and the activities of the KPRA and secret documents of the Japanese imperialist army, police, secret agency and the puppet Manchukuo.
					
					 The book has an appendix dealing with materials about the Japanese imperialists' moves to escalate the war at that time and other data and publications that introduced the development of the anti-Japanese and anti-war struggle of the Korean people under the influence of the anti-Japanese armed struggle.

articles.title: Area of Kumsusan Memorial Palace Gets Thickly Wooded
articles.content:
Area of Kumsusan Memorial Palace Gets Thickly Wooded
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The area of the Kumsusan Memorial Palace, where President Kim Il Sung lies in state, has become thickly wooded to suit the sacred temple of Juche.  
					 From the beginning of the year, more than 70,000 saplings of box, 10,000 plants of azalea and royal azalea and many other plants and flowers were transplanted around the palace.
					
					 Trees of good species, including gingko and dawn redwood, and rare plants are growing in the arboretum of the palace, adding beauty to the area. 
					
					 According to data available, hundreds of thousands of trees of several hundred species have rooted around the palace over the past 16 years.

articles.title: Pyongyangji Telling History of Pyongyang
articles.content:
Pyongyangji Telling History of Pyongyang
Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Pyongyangji (Pyongyang Review), brought out in the late 16th century, is one of the Korean nation's precious heritages telling the history of Pyongyang.
					 It was compiled by Yun Tu Su (1533-1601), governor of Phyongan Province and Pyongyang.
					
					 It consists of 32 parts, including history, forts, customs, beauty spots, shrines, government offices and schools.
					
					 The history part says that Pyongyang had been the capital city since the period of Tangun Korea and it had also been called Sogyong or Ryugyong.
					
					 The fort part gives a detailed introduction of the Walled City of Pyongyang, the wall in Mt. Taesong and other walls and forts, while the beauty spot part introduces places of superb scenic beauty in Pyongyang like the Ulmil Pavilion, Rungna Islet and Chongryu Cliff.
					
					 The book also deals with cereals, animals and plants in Pyongyang and famous figures like Ulji Mun Dok and On Tal.
					
					 Pyongyangji, one of the typical ancient books introducing Korean towns, serves as a valuable thing in studying the time-honored history and development of Pyongyang.

articles.title: Fellowship between Kim Il Sung and Takeo Takaki
articles.content:
Fellowship between Kim Il Sung and Takeo Takaki
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Takeo Takaki, who was an advisor to the editorial board of the Japanese Yomiuri Shimbun, recited an impromptu poem on the evening of December 31, Juche 60 (1971), before enjoying a New Year performance of schoolchildren at the Pyongyang Students and Children's Palace.
					 He was deeply moved at children running towards President Kim Il Sung, calling him "father!" and giving enthusiastic cheers when he arrived at the palace.
					
					 When the President met him, he said, "Now I am very excited. I think it is only you among the state leaders of the world who greet the New Year with children".
					
					  He voiced his impressions in the poem.
					
					 After being honored with the audience of the President again in January 1972, he began to write a travelogue titled "Kim Il Sung, Master of Leadership".
					
					 The travelogue was carried by Yomiuri Shimbun in serial form. At that time, he had his house in pledge and lost his wife, due to obstructive moves of the Japanese reactionaries.
					
					 Takaki formed the Japan-Korea Cultural Interchange Association and worked hard for amicability between the Japanese and Korean people.
					
					 One spring day in 1973, a delegation of the Journalists Union of Korea, on a visit to Japan, called at his home.
					
					 The delegation conveyed the President's regards and gift to Takaki and mourned the death of his wife as requested by the President.
					
					 At a meeting with him in Pyongyang in May 1975, the President said he would spend the whole day with him to have a talk as old friends regardless of their jobs.
					
					 When he was about to make a tour of the revolutionary battle sites in the area of Mt. Paektu, the President made a plane and a doctor available for him, afraid of the 70-year-old Japanese man's health.
					
					 When Takaki wrote the first two parts of a book about Mt. Paektu, the President read it and had it published in Korea, too.
					
					 While writing the third part, Takaki fell senseless.
					
					 In his last moment he told his disciples, "The Korean nation will surely achieve the reunification of the country under the leadership of President Kim Il Sung. This is the direction of the historical development. The Japanese people should not obstruct it. I wish I would die in Pyongyang".
					
					 Upon hearing the news of his death, the President saw to it that an obituary was published in local newspapers and relevant public organizations expressed condolences over his death.
					
					 He also sent a message of condolence to the bereaved family. 
					
					 A feature film about the life of Takaki was produced in Korea.

articles.title: Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (4)
articles.content:
Worthwhile Life under Care of Great Leader (4)
Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Under the care of General Secretary Kim Jong Il ordinary women at the Kim Chaek Iron and Steel Complex became famous for their heroic exploits to be admired by the whole country. It was Han Ok Ryon who initiated the patriotic labor drive to help workers at spare time and became head of this group. This vigorous movement is now afoot among women at the complex.
					 The number of members of the group who heartily responded to her call to join the workers of the complex was on the steady increase. Their patriotic devotion greatly helped the complex round off the Juche-iron production system last year and honor its iron and steel production plan for the same year.
					
					 In April this year Kim Jong Il called on its workers again and spared time to meet with Han, showing such great loving care for her that her family could never forget generation after generation.
					
					 Cherishing Kim Jong Il's words of trust that the women of the complex were excellent, indeed, Han Ok Ryon and other members of the group are now doing their best to repay his trust and benevolence.

articles.title: S. Korean Authorities Hit for Suppressing Teachers Union
articles.content:
S. Korean Authorities Hit for Suppressing Teachers Union
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Members of the south Korean Democratic Labor Party on July 4 entered a hunger sit-in strike outside Chongwadae in protest against the prosecution's unreasonable investigation into the Teachers Union.
					 Prior to the sit-in strike, the party held a press conference in Jongro District, Seoul.
					
					 Speakers at the press conference denounced the Lee Myung Bak regime for letting the prosecution crack down on members of the union by linking them with the party.
					
					 This is aimed to disorganize the progressive opposition party and organizations it deems obstructive to the regime and calm down the public criticism of the "government" and the ruling party for varieties of scandals, they charged.
					
					 They declared they would positively cooperate with members of the union in the actions.

articles.title: Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Remarks Flailed
articles.content:
Lee Myung Bak's Anti-DPRK Remarks Flailed
Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The south Korean newspaper Hangyore on July 4 carried an editorial accusing traitor Lee Myung Bak of hypocritical remarks insisting on the policy of confrontation with the DPRK.
					 On July 1 Lee, while uttering this or that about the "Cheonan" warship case and the Yonphyong Island shelling case, let loose a spate of rubbish that "one should have sincerity and responsibility" and "it is necessary to head for dialogue and cooperation," the editorial said.
					
					 At a glance it seems that he would make a switchover in the basic orientation of the policy toward the north but that is not his real intention, added the editorial.
					
					 Now that the distrust between the south and the north is deeper due to the present south Korean regime, it is more necessary than ever before for the chief executive to make proper remarks, it held.
					
					 It urged Lee to recognize the unreasonable "policy toward the north" at once and come out to develop NGOs' cooperation and exchange with the north.

articles.title: S. Korean Police Suppress Workers in Their Actions for Right to Existence
articles.content:
S. Korean Police Suppress Workers in Their Actions for Right to Existence 
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The south Korean police on July 4 put down the actions of workers for vital rights outside the Young Do Shipbuilding Yard of the Hanjin Heavy Industries Co. Ltd., and walked off participants.
					 Workers including members of the Pusan Headquarters of the Confederation of Trade Unions who had been on sit-in strikes for several days in protest against the management side's unreasonable layoff held a candlelight rally outside the yard that day.
					
					 When the rally was declared open, the riot police which cordoned off the yard labeled the candlelight action illegal and took away more than 20 workers and citizens to police stations.

articles.title: Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Various Countries
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated in Various Countries
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Events took place in various countries from Jun. 29 to Jul. 2 on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung. They included round-table talks in Peru, a meeting to remember President Kim Il Sung in Switzerland, a reading session and film show in Ethiopia.  
					 The participants of the film show watched the Korean film "Fireworks for a Thriving Nation".
					
					 Tani Baler Lopera, international secretary of the Communist Party of Peru (Red Motherland), said that the political idea of the President was to believe in people as in Heaven and devote his all to them, always finding himself among them.
					
					 Kim Il Sung will always be alive with the human history as he was deeply respected and trusted by the people in his lifetime.
					
					 Martin Lotscher, chairman of the Switzerland-Korea Committee, spoke highly of Kim Il Sung as a great statesman who devoted his all to the prosperity of the country, people's happiness and national reunification all his life.
					
					 He referred to the fact that General Secretary Kim Jong Il, creditable successor to the ideology and cause of Kim Il Sung, has wisely led the Korean people's drive for building a great prosperous and powerful nation. 
					
					 A message to Kim Jong Il was adopted at the event in Switzerland.

articles.title: Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
articles.content:
Anniversary of Demise of Kim Il Sung Commemorated
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The international and regional organizations dedicated special write-ups to the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The Korean Friendship Association headquartered in Spain posted on its internet homepage "One Korean Network" a portrait of the President and an article praising him for performing immortal exploits for the human cause of independence.
					
					 The article noted that the Non-aligned Movement is also associated with the deep attention of the President and his positive activities. It referred to the devoted efforts made by him for the development of the NAM.
					
					 Many countries in the world let a lot of streets, institutions and organizations go by the august name of the President and international and regional organizations and heads of parties, states and governments of many countries and personages from various circles presented the President with gifts and awarded him honorary titles, orders, etc., the article noted, adding that the exploits performed by Kim Il Sung in the struggle for making the whole world independent will shine forever.
					
					 The International Alliance of Societies for the Study of the Juche Idea and Songun Policy in East European and Central Asian Regions on July 1 edited an article on the internet homepage under the title "For the Independence of the Whole World" with a photo of the President conducting foreign activities.
					
					 The article gave a detailed account of the fact that the President conducted energetic foreign activities for making the whole world independent and helped the peoples of various countries materially and morally in their anti-imperialist and anti-fascist national liberation struggle in his lifetime.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung Praised by Bangladeshi Party Leader
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung Praised by Bangladeshi Party Leader
Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Khaleq Zaman Bhuiyan, general secretary of the Central Committee of the Socialist Party of Bangladesh, issued a statement on July 4 on the occasion of the 17th anniversary of demise of President Kim Il Sung.
					 The statement recalled with deep emotion the undying feats of the President on the anniversary of his demise. It went on:
					
					 The President was an invincible and iron-willed brilliant commander who embarked upon the road of revolution in his early years, founded the immortal Juche idea and defeated two imperialisms in one generation and a peerlessly great man who devoted his all to the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, the strengthening of the socialist movement and the triumphant advance of the human cause of independence. 
					
					 General Secretary Kim Jong Il set a brilliant example in the cause of perpetuating the memory of the President and has carried forward the revolutionary cause of Juche started by the President generation after generation with his unique Songun politics.
					
					 We are convinced that the Korean people will certainly achieve the cause of building a thriving socialist nation and the cause of the independent and peaceful reunification of the country, the behests of the President, under the Songun revolutionary leadership of Kim Jong Il.

articles.title: Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Cambodia
articles.content:
Kim Il Sung to Be Remembered in Cambodia
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The Cambodian Preparatory Committee for Remembering President Kim Il Sung was inaugurated on July 1.
					 Kong Sam Ol, deputy prime minister in charge of the Royal Palace, was elected chairman of the preparatory committee at the instruction of King Norodom Sihamoni.
					
					 The committee set the remembrance period from July 1 to 15 and decided to give wide media publicity to the greatness and undying feats of the President and hold remembrance events.

articles.title: Korean People's Struggle Favored by Bulgarian Organization
articles.content:
Korean People's Struggle Favored by Bulgarian Organization
Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The Bulgaria-Korea Friendship Association on July 1 issued its bulletin No. 3 on the occasion of the June 25-July 27 month of anti-U.S. joint struggle.
					 The bulletin in articles recalled that the international community set the period from June 25 to July 27 every year as a month of international solidarity with the Korean people. The U.S. imperialists and the south Korean puppet army started armed invasion against the DPRK on June 25, 1950, it noted.
					
					 Under the wise leadership of President Kim Il Sung the Korean People's Army went over to an immediate counter-attack, liberating Seoul three days after the start of the war and liberating more than 90 percent of the area of the southern half of Korea in a brief span of time. It finally won a brilliant victory on July 27, 1953, it said.
					
					 It condemned the present chief executive of south Korea for letting loose a string of balderdash about the issue of Korean reunification.
					
					 It urged the south Korean authorities to pay attention to the proposal for achieving reunification by federal formula solemnly declared at home and abroad in the June 15 joint declaration.

articles.title: Differing Views on Greek Financial Crisis
articles.content:
Differing Views on Greek Financial Crisis 
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The financial crisis in Greece is again drawing world attention.
					 The EU heads agreed to provide financial aid to Greece to help it tide over the financial crisis in Brussels, Belgium recently. Greece received the aid last year.
					
					 The Greek parliament accepted the proposal for cutting down the government expenditure by 2015, which the EU raised as a precondition for the aid, and adopted a mid-term economic austerity plan according to it.
					
					 It was reported that the EU and IMF would formally sign the new aid plan in July.
					
					 Some people describe the efforts made by Greece and EU to tide over the crisis as futile, asserting the euro-zone will soon collapse.
					
					 Bernanke, chairman of the Board of Governors of the U.S. Federal Reserve System, said Greek economic slump would endanger the unitary political structure in Europe.
					
					 The executive director of CEBR said the Greeks and the international community will soon be fed up with this meaningless struggle and this will lead to a collapse of the currency union.
					
					 He meant the euro zone might cease to exist by 2013. 
					
					 EU, however, is not so hopeless about the grim situation in Greece. It says the country's economy will surely recover by 2013.
					
					 EU voiced its willingness to defend euro, protect euro zone and tide over the financial crisis in Europe by closely cooperating with each other at the 41st International Economic Forum in Switzerland early this year. It is now making efforts to put it into practice.
					
					 China predicted the euro zone can make stable economic progress and promised to increase loans for EU member nations and boost trade with them.
					
					 How the situation will turn out over the serious financial and monetary crisis of the EU member nations triggered by the financial crisis in the U.S. is drawing attention of the world people.

articles.title: National Knowledge Contest for Party Building Held in China
articles.content:
National Knowledge Contest for Party Building Held in China
 Beijing, July 6 (KCNA) -- A national knowledge contest for party building took place from May to June on the occasion of the 90th founding anniversary of the Communist Party of China.
					The contest brought together 26 12,000 members from different parts of the country. 
					
					 The contest contributed to educating the cadres, party members and broad masses in the spirit of loving the party, the state and socialism.

articles.title: Internet Photo Exhibition Opens in China
articles.content:
Internet Photo Exhibition Opens in China
 Beijing, July 6 (KCNA) -- "Following Party Forever", an Internet photo exhibition sponsored by the All-China Federation of Trade Unions, was opened in Beijing on June 30 to celebrate the 90th founding anniversary of the Communist Party of China.
					 Important websites including Xinhua network displayed photos and collected impressions.
					
					 Internet will help its users know about the glorious history in which the working people and the Federation have worked hard to achieve national independence, the people's emancipation and the prosperity of the country under the leadership of the party.

articles.title: CPLA Information Drill Starts
articles.content:
CPLA Information Drill Starts
 Beijing, July 6 (KCNA) -- The large-scale information drill codenamed "Vanguard-211" started at the Jinan Military Area of the Chinese People's Liberation Army recently.
					 More than 11,000 troops are involved in the drill.
					
					 The chief of the operations department of the Command of the Jinan Military Area said that the drill would be divided into five phases including mobility and gathering and counter exercise.

articles.title: Intensified Ideological and Political Education of Students Called for in China
articles.content:
Choe Thae Bok Meets Vietnamese Ambassador
Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the Supreme People's Assembly, Thursday had a talk with Le Quang Ba, a newly-appointed Vietnamese ambassador to the DPRK, when the latter paid a courtesy call on him at the Mansudae Assembly Hall.

articles.title: Hariri Court Has Ties with Western Intelligence Agencies: Hezbollah Chief
articles.content:
Hariri Court Has Ties with Western Intelligence Agencies: Hezbollah Chief
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- The leader of Lebanese Shiite armed group Hezbollah said accusations traded against four members of his party of involvement in the assassination on Lebanese Sunni former Prime Minister Rafik Hariri, adding that a prominent CIA agent was part of the team of investigators looking into the 2005 killing.
					 The Special Tribunal for Lebanon (STL), which is probing the Hariri crime, submitted to Lebanese authorities this week a sealed indictment. 
					
					He also described investigators looking into the Hariri assassination and some of the STL staff as "biased and corrupt."

articles.title: Iraqi Legislators Want US Troops out
articles.content:
Iraqi Legislators Want US Troops out
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- A member of the Iraqi Parliament says 100 legislators have called on the government to demand the departure of U.S. forces from the country.
					"The legislators have signed 100 signatures, calling on the government to demand the departure of the U.S. occupation forces, in compliance with the security agreement signed between Baghdad and Washington," Uday Awad of the al-Ahrar (Liberals) Bloc told the Aswat al-Iraq news agency Monday.

articles.title: Iran Warns US against War Moves
articles.content:
Iran Warns US against War Moves
Tehran, July 6 (KCNA) -- The chairman of the parliament Defense Committee of Iran when interviewed by a news agency on July 2 warned the U.S. against its anti-Iran moves.
					 All the U.S. military bases in the Mideast are within the range of Iran's missile strike, he said, declaring if the U.S. commits military attack on Iran, Iran will mercilessly strike the bases.
					
					 He urged the U.S. to make a switchover in its wrong policy toward the regional countries and respect the rights of other countries.

articles.title: Belarusian President Exposes Reactionary Nature of "Color Revolution"
articles.content:
Belarusian President Exposes Reactionary Nature of "Color Revolution"
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Belarusian President Aleksandr Lukashenko, speaking at a ceremony on July 3, exposed the reactionary nature of the "color revolution". 
					 The shameless "color revolution" used in some countries is being persistently imposed on his country, he said, adding it is aimed to foster uneasiness to do harm to social harmony and finally bring Belarus to its knees and destroy all the gains attained by the people.
					
					 Some circles are seeking their interests in politics and working hard to use force, pressure and economic sanctions to meet them but Belarus will weather all difficulties and ordeals, he stressed.

articles.title: Paraguayan President Calls for Eliminating Poverty
articles.content:
Paraguayan President Calls for Eliminating Poverty
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Paraguayan President Fernando Armindo Lugo Mendez Friday called for fighting poverty.
					 He said this is an ethic and moral issue to solve, which needs the consensus of all to reverse it.
					
					The government will make every possible effort to terminate poverty and provide the people with more affluent life, he added.

articles.title: Natural Disasters in China, Mexico
articles.content:
Natural Disasters in China, Mexico
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Heavy rains hit southern areas of China from June 28, causing damage.
					Five were killed and over 55,000 were evacuated in Zhejiang, Hunan, Guangdong, Sichuan and Yunnan provinces and Guangxi Zhuangzu Autonomous Region, according to the State Disaster Reduction Committee on July 2.
					
					 The number of the victims totals more than 1.5 million and economic loss amounts to 770 million RMB. Y.
					
					 Flood and landslide caused by heavy rains in Mexico left 16 persons dead and lots of houses and farmland destroyed as of July 3.

articles.title: Armenia Seizes Heroine
articles.content:
Armenia Seizes Heroine 
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- Armenia is actively combating drug trafficking.
					 It seized 90 kilograms of heroine from a routine check-up at the international airport near Yerevan on July 1, Armenian media reported.

Volcano Erupts in Indonesia
 Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- A volcano erupted in North Sulawesi Province, Indonesia on July 3, throwing volcanic ashes 6 000 meters into the air.
					 The surrounding area is declared a danger zone.

Earthquake Hits Taiwan
Pyongyang, July 7 (KCNA) -- A 5-magnitude earthquake hit Taiwan on July 3.
					 The epicenter was waters off the east coast.

En Pyongyang conjunto artistico de China

articles.title: Siguen mitines provinciales de condena a banda de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
Siguen mitines provinciales de condena a banda de Lee Myung Bak
Pyongyang, 7 de julio (ATCC) -- Tuvieron lugar el dia 6 en las provincias de Hwanghae del Sur, de Kangwon y la ciudad de Kaesong los mitines de militares y civiles de condena a los crimenes de la banda del traidor Lee Myung Bak.
					  En las ocasiones se dio lectura a la declaracion del portavoz de la Comandancia Suprema del Ejercito Popular de Corea y hubo intervenciones.
					
					  Los oradores advirtieron que nunca pueden vivir en esta tierra y bajo este cielo con quienes insultan atrevidamente la maxima dignidad de la RPDC y desacreditan su sistema y ejercito.
					
					  Ellos dijeron que se han hecho mas firme la decision y la voluntad del ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC de aplastar despiadadamente a los traidores y levantar en esta tierra el Estado prospero reunificado.
					
					  Si la banda de los traidores recurre de continuo a los tejemanejes de provocar una nueva guerra, el ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC libraran la implacable guerra sagrada de represalia segun lo han advertido, para asi eliminar en esta tierra a todos los traidores y lograr la historica causa de la reunificacion de la patria, anhelo de la nacion coreana, destacaron.
					
					　A los mitines asistieron los cuadros directivos de las instituciones del partido y el Poder y las entidades de trabajadores, oficiales y soldados del EPC, trabajadores de distintos sectores, jovenes y estudiantes de las respectivas localidades.

articles.title: IRP publica carta blanca de la chismografia de Lee Myung Bak
articles.content:
IRP revela la chismografia de Lee Myung Bak
　Pyongyang, 7 de julio (ATCC) -- El Instituto de la Reunificacion de la Patria (IRP) publico el dia 6 una carta blanca para revelar la chismografia conflictiva anti-reunificacion del traidor surcoreano Lee Myung Bak.
					　Segun el documento, en su declaracion de postulado a la presidencia, Lee califico el sorprendente desarrollo de las relaciones intercoreanas despues de publicada la Declaracion Conjunta N-S del 15 de Junio como "las que se dejaron llevar por el Norte" y de "10 anos perdidos".
					
					　En la rueda de prensa que tuvo lugar el primero de febrero de 2008, rehuso practicamente la ejecucion de la declaracion N-S, diciendo que "No es una obligacion del sucesor lo que han suscrito los politicos (antecesores) en Pyongyang. Sobre todo, clasificare lo que debo cumplir ahora y despues y lo que no puedo hacer".
					
					　Al pronunciar el discurso de investidura, Lee aclaro su posicion de "solucionar la politica sobre el Norte no con el ideal, sino con la pauta de pragmatismo". Y en su "discurso por el Primero de Marzo", que acogio por primera vez como presidente, y el acto de nombramiento de los generales del ejercito titere surcoreano efectuado el 3 de abril, dijo que el ideal "Entre nosotros, los connacionales" es un "nacionalismo de estrecha vision" y "chovinismo nacional", agregando que "con ese ideal no puede solucionar el problema de relaciones Sur-Norte".
					
					　Para impedir el dialogo y el avance de relaciones entre el Norte y el Sur, el uso todos los pretextos como la "renuncia nuclear", la "sinceridad", el "mantenimiento de principios" y el "cambio de la actitud del Norte".
					
					　Al recibir el 26 de marzo de 2008 el informe de trabajo del Ministerio de Reunificacion, frustro los proyectos de cooperacion entre ambas partes coreanas hablando de la "renuncia nuclear, primero" y la "entrega desmesurada" al Norte y el 12 de noviembre,  hablo de que "estan esperando el cambio de la actitud por el Norte. La espera es tambien una estrategia".
					
					　Ademas, no vacilo en pronunciar estas palabras: "No procederemos a las conversaciones que falten a los principios", "Pienso que las relaciones intercoreanas de ahora van en la orbita normal", "No me importa que no haya ninguna cumbre S-N durante mi mandato".
					
					　Chismeo el 30 de noviembre de 2007 que el "Norte debe saber que no podria esperar nada si no opta por la cancelacion nuclear, la reforma y la apertura". En una entrevista de prensa sostenida a principios de febrero de 2008, afirmo que la "cancelacion nuclear del Norte resulta la mayor premisa de las relaciones S-N" y definio oficialmente la "desnuclearizacion, apertura y 3 mil dolares" como "politica sobre el Norte" al pronunciar el discurso de investidura el 25 de febrero de 2008.
					
					　En el discurso de apertura de la 18a "Asamblea Nacional" pronunciado el 11 de julio de 2008 y en una rueda de prensa con los medios extranjeros sostenida el 26 de septiembre, el traidor Lee enfatizo que la "renuncia nuclear del Norte" es la "mayor prioridad de la politica sobre el Norte", "tarea primordial", "asunto mas importante", etc. De esta manera, expuso mas abiertamente su intento de no dar ni un paso adelante en las relaciones N-S antes de que fuera resuelto el problema nuclear del Norte.
					
					　En flagrante violacion de ese principio principal de relaciones intercoreanas y de los Tres Principios de la Reunificacion de la Patria, el traidor Lee Myung Bak persiguio persistentemente el enfrentamiento de sistemas hablando del "cambio" y "apertura" de alguien y de la "reunificacion bajo el sistema democratico liberal". De esta manera, llevo las relaciones Norte-Sur a la fase irremediablemente catastrofica.
					
					　Ademas, definio la mision y la funcion del Ministerio titere de Reunificacion no como la mejora de relaciones intercoreanas ni la reconciliacion ni la cooperacion, sino como la "reunificacion mediante la absorcion". Y movilizo a las escorias humanas de toda calana en el lanzamiento de volantes y la radiodifusion intrigante contra la RPDC.
					
					　El 26 de septiembre de 2008, visito el campo de ejercicio de prueba de la artilleria conjunta del ejercito titere surcoreano y alabo a los belicistas militares diciendo que "En la guerra moderna no hay limites entre el frente y la retaguardia. Es preciso entrar en la disposicion de reaccion perfecta". El 4 de mayo de 2010, en la reunion de los principales comandantes del ejercito titere y otras ocasiones, les exigio "establecer la concepcion de enemigo principal" haciendo referencia al "estado hostil con el Norte" y a las "circunstancias especiales".
					
					　En la declaracion al pueblo sobre el incidente de hundimiento de la corbeta "Cheonan", y durante la charla con los compinches del Consejo Consultivo por la Democracia, la Paz y la Reunificacion, el traidor Lee pronuncio un paquete de disparates tales como "hay que saber que a solo 50 kilometros delante de nosotros esta desplegado el colectivo mas belicoso", "se debe tomar una posicion rotunda", "no hay que temer a la guerra" y "es el momento de actuar en vez de hablar". 
					
					　El 23 de noviembre y el 23 de diciembre de 2010 cuando se traslado al puesto de mando del cuartel del Estado Mayor Conjunto del ejercito surcoreano y a una unidad militar en el frente avanzado, dijo otros chismes como "hay que responder por encima de las normas de beligerancia", "es preciso lanzar una gran contraofensiva", "le haremos pagar el precio debido" y "hay que abrir bien los ojos hacia el Norte".
					
					　El fanatismo por el enfrentamiento y la guerra del traidor Lee se ha constatado el 24 de junio de 2011 cuando dijo ante los miembros de la comision de defensa nacional de la titere Asamblea Nacional, reunidos en Chongwadae, que "Me ha sido un rencor tremendo que no puedo ahogar todavia el hecho de que no pudimos atacar al Norte durante el fuego artillero en la isla Yonphyong. Casi me reventaba de colera. Es insoportable".
					
					　Los disparates de Lee mencionados hasta ahora no pasan de ser una parte de lo publicado en las publicaciones surcoreanas.
					
					　El ejercito y el pueblo de la RPDC enjuiciaran sin falta, junto con todos los coreanos, a la camarilla del vendepatria Lee Myung Bak por sus imperdonables e inauditos crimenes de traicion

articles.title: Conversaciones "2+2" para la  alianza militar, comentario de ATCC
articles.content:
Conversaciones "2+2" para la  alianza militar, comentario de ATCC
Pyongyang, 7 de julio (ATCC) -- Hace poco, se realizo en Washington, Estados Unidos, la reunion del comite consultivo por la seguridad Estados Unidos-Japon con la participacion de los secretarios de Estado y de Defensa de EE.UU. y los ministros de Relaciones Exteriores y de Defensa de Japon, o sea, las conversaciones "2+2". 
					　En la ocasion ambas partes fijaron la "meta estrategica conjunta" de frenar las "provocaciones del Norte de Corea" y fortalecer el sistema de cooperacion por la seguridad con el Sur de Corea y Australia frente a la "situacion de seguridad incierta" de la region de Asia-Pacifico. 
					
					　El hecho muestra que EE.UU. impulsa persistentemente los preparativos para fundar una alianza militar al estilo de OTAN con el designio de aplastar a la RPDC, baluarte del socialismo y de la independencia antiimperialista en la region de Asia-Pacifico y resistir a los "rivales potenciales" como China.
					
					　Ademas, el imperio tiene el calculo estrategico de modificar a su favor la estructura politico-militar de esta region para realizar la ambicion hegemonica. 
					
					　En el nuevo siglo, en la region de Asia-Pacifico surgieron China, la India y otros paises como  potencias emergentes alcanzando simultaneamente el desarrollo vertiginoso. Y el centro politico, economico y militar del mundo se traslada desde Europa a esta region. En especial, se agranda cada dia mas la influencia economica de los paises emergentes de esta region a los aliados de EE.UU. 
					
					　Tales hechos pueden debilitar el dominio de EE.UU. sobre esta region.
					
					　En el informe de estrategia sobre Asia, publicado en mayo de 2001, EE.UU. presento como nueva meta estrategica fundar la alianza militar capaz de contener a los "rivales potenciales" regionales como China y controlar a Japon, el Sur de Corea y otros paises aliados.
					
					　Durante un decenio desde entonces, vino acelerando sistematicamente la fundacion de la "OTAN de cuno asiatico" tomando por nucleo la alianza con Japon, el Sur de Corea y Australia e incorporando hasta los paises de Asia oriental. 
					
					　Puso en funcionamiento el dialogo tripartito por la seguridad con Japon y Australia, permitio intencionalmente la salida militar a ultramar de Japon y desarrollo las conversaciones "2+2" como un eslabon para restringir perpetuamente a Japon. 
					
					　Bajo el pretexto de la "prevencion de proliferacion de armas de exterminio masivo", se entrego a los ejercicios militares para perfeccionar el sistema de cooperacion militar multinacional en la region de Asia-Pacifico. 
					
					　Como resultado, aparecio en esta region la "OTAN de cuno asiatico" como una nueva estructura de seguridad multinacional.
					
					  El movimiento hegemonico de EE.UU. provoca una gran preocupacion del mundo por su peligrosidad que pueda acarrear una nueva guerra fria. 
					
					  El siglo pasado dejo a la historia la amarga leccion de que la guerra fria conlleva la guerra caliente y trae la consecuencia catastrofica a la paz y la estabilidad del mundo. 
					
					  Las guerras desatadas en el ambito mundial durante la guerra fria como la coreana, la vietnamita, la Iran-Iraq, la afgana, etc., causaron incontables sufrimientos y perdidas a muchos paises y naciones y violaron gravemente la paz y la estabilidad. 
					
					  No se ha eliminado todavia la consecuencia de la guerra fria y se agrava cada dia mas la situacion de la Peninsula Coreana y de otras varias regiones. 
					
					  EE.UU. pretende fabricar una nueva alianza militar tomando el Nordeste Asiatico como escenario principal con el fin de utilizarlo como brigada de choque de la agresion contra la RPDC y como un aparato para cercar y controlar a los "rivales ocultos" como China. 
					
					  Esto acarreara una consecuencia irremediable a todo el mundo, incluso la region de Asia-Pacifico, que se hace el centro estrategico del siglo XXI.
					
					  Las maniobras de las fuerzas hegemonicas que persiguen la confrontacion y la guerra, a contrapelo de la tendencia hacia la paz, el desarrollo y la cooperacion, despiertan la conciencia de los paises regionales y seran inevitablemente fracasadas por su caracter reaccionario e imprudente.
